result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronnie L. McAfee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ronnie L. McAfee is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ronnie L. McAfee was found guilty of Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).
  • Ronnie L. McAfee was found guilty of Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
02-18-16/ Judge Jeffrey A Wagner
Court ordered that the defendant's motion for postconviction relief is granted in part:  the DNA surcharges on counts one and two in 13CF003157 and on count three in 14CF000622 are vacated.
The defendant's motion to vacate the DNA surcharges in 14CF000383 and count nine in 14CF000622 is DENIED.
The defendant's motion to order the DOC to change the defendant's prison funds withholding percentage is DENIED. 

As stated in count nine.

To be served in Wisconsin State Prison.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to 14CF383 and 13CF3157 and consecutive to any other sentence.

AS TO THIS CASE:  $738.14 to The Fire Place LTD; $2,669.60 to Kashou Carpets; $1,205.00 to Milwaukee Glass Block; $621.00 to Advance Landscaping and $1,864.95 to ProBuild.

AS TO THE DISIMISSED AND READ IN CHARGES BETWEEN THIS CASE, 14cf383, 13cf3157:  $1,434,83 to Milleagers; $4,733.44 TO  Drexel; $3,3234.82 to First Supply; $2,867.47 TO Carpet City AND $977.43 TO Sterling Mainz Plumbing.
Restitution to be paid first.

AS TO THIS CASE:  Provide DNA sample if one has not been provided, pay all appropriate costs on each count.  Pay all appropriate costs, surcharges and special assessments. To be paid from up to 25% of prison funds and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  To convert to civl judgment that is nondischargable in bankruptcy.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to count three and consecutive to 14CF383 and 13CF3157 and consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain employment.  Vocational training. Parenting classes.

No controlled substances or alcohol.
No contact with Larry S., Darnell L., any of the victim (suppliers), Jeremy B. and Michael S.
AODA assessment and treatment. Random urine screens.

Partially Granting Motion for Postconviction Relief, signed and filed.
IT IS HEREBY ORDERED the defendant's motion for postconviction relief is granted in part; the DNA surcharges on counts one and two in 13CF3157 and on count three in 14CF622 are VACATED.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the motion to vacate the DNA surcharges in 14CF383 and count nine in 14CF622 is denied.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the motion to order the DOC to change the defendant's prison funds withholding percentage is denied.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Wagner, Br. 38, calendar successor, for review. mag

records.addlTxt: Count three.
Count nine

Defendant Ronnie L. McAfee in court with attorney Alexis R Liggins.  Defendant Ronnie L. McAfee in custody.  David A Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Sallie M.
The Court imposes the following  Sentence:  As to Count 3:  Defendant's TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE shall be 90 days in the HOC to be served in WPS.  As to Count 9:  Defendant's TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE shall be for 2 years consecutive to Count 3.  Defendant's TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin Prison System shall be for 1 year.  Defendant shall serve 1 year on EXTENDED SUPERVISION.
Sentences are consecutive to 14CF383 and 13CF3157 and consecutive to any other sentence.  There is no credit days.
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court advised the defendant of his determinate sentence pursuant to statute and in accordance with Form 1910 R3.
Conditions of Extended Supervision are:
- no controlled substance or alcohol
- AODA assessment and treatment with random urine screens
- no contact with Larry B, Darnell L, any of the victims (suppliers), Jeremy B and Michael S
- seek and maintain employment
- vocational training
- parenting classes
- cognitive thinking counseling
- defendant shall provide a DNA sample, if one has not been provided and pay all appropriate costs on each count
- Court ordered restitution in the total amount of $173,124.74 on this case and cases 14CF383, 13CF3157 and dismissed and read in cases from Racine and Waukesha counties. Restitution on this case paid at $738.14 to The Fire Place LTD, $2,669.60 to Kashou Carpets, $1,205.00 to Milwaukee Glass Block, $621.10 to Advance Landscaping and $1,864.95 to ProBuild.  Defendant to pay restitution on cases 14CF383 and 13CF3157.  Defendant to pay restitution in the amounts of $1,434.83 to Mileagers, $4,733.44 to Drexel, $3,234.82 to First Supply, $2,867.47 to Carpet City and $977.43 to Sterling Mainz Plumbing.  Restitution to be paid first.
The Court ordered that restitution and all appropriate costs, surcharges and special assessments be paid from up to 25% of the defendant's prison funds and as a condition of Extended Supervision to convert to a civil judgment that is non-dischargble in bankruptcy.  Defendant is REMANDED.  
Filed with the Court:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Written Explanation of Deteminate Sentence.
Victim impact statement, restitution worksheet and stipulated restitution amoutns worksheet, received and filed
/from defendant to the Court dated 3/30/14, received and filed. rn
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed. rn
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Ronnie L. McAfee in court with attorney Alexis Ray Liggins.  Defendant Ronnie L. McAfee in custody.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to negotiations, the State moved to dismiss outright Count 2, and moved to dismiss but read in  Counts #1, #4, #5, #6, #7, and #8.  Court granted State's motion and ordered Count 2 dismissed and Counts #1, #4, #5, #6, #7 and #8 dismissed but read in.

AS TO COUNTS 3 AND 9:
Plea hearing proceeds.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms. Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility,  Parties requested an adjournment for the sentencing hearing to attempt to consolidate cases from other counties into this case.   Court granted joint request and ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 20 on 4/17/14 at 1:30 p.m.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for plea and sentencing before Branch 20.
Court set bail at $3,500.00 CASH with TOT to Justice Point, with absolute sobriety; no alcohol or drugs; random testing; no firearms or weapons.

Defendant Ronnie L. McAfee in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Ronnie L. McAfee in custody.  David A Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  rn  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, to accompany defendant's lower-pending cases.   Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of maximum penalties.  Complaint given to defendant's attorney.
Court appearance in Room 113 Safety Building on 2/18/14 @ 1:30pm
